column4: How do I find my HDD when I boot Ubuntu from the installation CD?
you should be able to mount from places under the livecd
places menu that is.
I only see the bootloader partition
are you at the boot screen or actually in ubuntu live ?
and are you attempting to install or just looking for your hdd?
what do you get with fdisk -l ?
I get nothing at all.
sudo fdisk -l
/dev/sda seems to be my HDD.
can you please paste the whole output in pastebin
I can't get that machine online. No ethernet jack nearby.
I have /dev/sda1 (Linux LVM), /dev/sda2 (Extended), and /dev/sda5 (Linux)
that makes more sense thanks
/dev/sda1 has the most blocks, I guess that's my main partition.
no ?
dev/sda1 sounds like your main partition
sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt
mount: unknown filesystem type 'LVM2_member'
encrypted ...
sorry was quick to jump to conclusions ... http://adityo.blog.binusian.org/?p=762
